thread.section_title: The Argus-Press - arts and entertainment,arts and entertainment/
thread.title: Lightin’ up the night

author: SALLY YORK, Argus-Press Staff Writer
title: Lightin’ up the night
text:
Courtesy Photo Marquee 
ELECTRICIAN CARL LUDINGTON is seen taking apart the marquee at the Lebowsky Center in downtown Owosso. Courtesy Photo Marquee 
Last month the Owosso Community Players received a $25,000 check earmarked for the Lebowsky Center’s marqee from the Movie Museum in memory of owner Don Schneider. Shown holding the check, from left, are Movie Museum secretary Don Nidefski, vice president Gary Ackley, treasurer Janice Goodrich and president Jason Hale. Behind them, from left, are Owosso Community Players board members Sue Ludington, Eric Davis, president-elect Mike Ash, Matt Hufnagel, executive director Kathy Brooks, treasurer Guy Salander, president Dr. Douglas Strong, Charlie Keenan, Jerry Frezon, Movie Museum volunteer Robert Hathon, OCP staffer Linda Keenan and OCP board member Paul Peters. Posted: Tuesday, October 13, 2015 11:15 am Lightin’ up the night By SALLY YORK, Argus-Press Staff Writer The Argus-Press | 0 comments 
OWOSSO — The community is about to see the light — on the new marquee at the Lebowsky Center. 
Nine hundred lights, to be exact. That’s how many bulbs it takes to frame the marquee sign and illuminate the area underneath.
